caption:
This photograph depicts a striking and arid landscape characterized by rolling desert hills and rugged mountain silhouettes in the background. The image captures the scene during what appears to be either dawn or dusk, given the soft light and long shadows that enhance the textured details of the terrain.

In the foreground, the focus is on a small, isolated compound consisting of several buildings. Notable among them are two prominent white structures that starkly contrast with the dark, earthy tones of the natural environment. These buildings, possibly constructed in a simple architectural style with flat roofs and minimal decorative elements, seem somewhat desolate and solitary in the vast, open desert.

The immediate terrain around these structures is rough and uneven, with sparse vegetation indicating a harsh, dry climate. Variations in the color and shape of the nearby hills suggest geological diversity, adding depth and visual interest to the scene. The landscape extends into the distance, where multiple layers of mountain ranges create a deep sense of space and seclusion. These mountains, fading into increasingly muted colors as they recede into the background, contribute to an overall sense of serene desolation in the image.
title: Sunset over the old Perry Mansion. Mule Ear Peak in background. Perry operated the Terlingua mercury mine. The mine was abandoned after World War II.
